page.title: 11The Fire Station
page.content: The {Fire Station}was built in 1972. It is a single storey building; one {fire appliance}for water, and a {foam appliance}which is used when there is a petrol or an oil fire. The {firemen}are alerted by the bleepers they carry in their pockets. The calls are sent out from the main fire station at Basildon. There are usually seven to nine firemen on call at any one time. There is a { {practice tower}behind the fire station. If any extra fire appliances are required they are sent from Basildon.
